results.title: 01 = Zero one. [Ep. 09]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items including: 1. On-site manufacturing of foam plastic igloos useful for emergency housing. 2. Electrical powered feeding cart for barn-housed cattle. 3. Offset dye stamping machines for postage stamps doubling the capacity of current machines. 4. Flu vaccine production. 5. Stock cars.

results.title: [World War II: France]
results.brief_description:
Includes silent film footage of Churchill, Montgomery, De Gaulle, Eisenhower; WWII soldiers in battle in France; aerial strikes; images shot near Montebourg and Cherbourge; German soldiers surrendering.
No credit information available - private or home movie filmmaker??

results.title: [Wool Fashion Awards, 1965 and 1966]
results.brief_description: Models show a variety of garments which won the Fashion Awards for 1966. Knitted jumpers, suits, skirts, and day and evening dresses, ensembles and coats. Photographed at Eltham using Montsalvat as a background.

results.title: [Wings to Vikingland]
results.brief_description: A tour of Sweden, Norway and Denmark by an American couple. The receive a traditional Swedish welcome in Stockholm; visit Lapland and the ancient city of Visby; Norway with its many fiords and mountains; the Viking and Ski Mountains; and finally Denmark - their tour of this country included visits to the royal castle, parliament building and University of Copenhagen.

results.title: [We have a home] = Wir haben ein heim!
results.brief_description: Made for exhibition in Germany to displaced persons to show the experiences of Europeans migrating to Australia. The film, with commentary in German, explains the system of providing community centres, education, work and recreational amenities at migrant camps to enable newcomers to become accustomed to the strangeness of the new country. The film was photographed at the Bonegilla Migrant Camp, Victoria.

results.title: [We go to school]
results.brief_description: Shows teachers how to help children make the normal adjustment from the home environment to that of the school. Discusses ways to foster a sense of belonging and an attitude of cooperation.

results.title: [Watching television]
results.brief_description: Short comic film made in 1958 by Graham Foster and friends to send to his relatives in New Zealand. Structured as ‘a mini sitcom’ the film features a group of friends engrossed in the act of watching television and has a voiceover by Foster. Features television advertising from the late 1950s. Companion piece to ‘A Kiwi in Exile’.

results.title: [Visit to Healesville Sanctuary by Princess Alexandra]
results.brief_description: Silent film recording the visit of Princess Alexandra to Healesville Sanctuary, Victoria. Includes many shots of the birds and animals at the Sanctuary.

results.title: [Viana Stern]
results.brief_description:
A U.F.O visits the Sydney Harbour Bridge; a Japanese tourist takes photos; a person meditates; people exercise and a plane flys by.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: [Various body movements using simple apparatus]
results.brief_description: A group of British school children demonstrate body movements using various types of apparatus, eg balance beams, hoops, boxes, mats and bars. The teacher stimulates the children by making them vary their movements and using the apparatus in many different ways - each movement flowing into the next.
